intro: Piptocarpha foliosa, commonly known as the leafy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils, and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Piptocarpha foliosa is often found in disturbed areas and can serve as a valuable component of local ecosystems.
